modName: Lind's Monk Robes Revamp - Texture Replacer
summary: New, HD texture for the Monk Robes featuring 2048x2048 Robes and Hood (Male and Female). A whole new look for all the priests and priestesses in Skyrim and another good reason to kill Heimskr.
descriptionHtml:
[center]-----------------------------------------------------------
[b][size=4]Description + Installation:[/size][/b]
-----------------------------------------------------------[/center]
[b]
This is a texture replacer for the Monk long robes (Male and Female) featuring 2048x2048 textures for both the robes and the hood.
Installation: Simply Unzip and copy the Data folder in your Skyrim directory. [u]Compatible with edited meshes for every body replacer.[/u] Be mindful that excessively skimpy meshes may distrupt the textures.
The .dds files should end up into Data/textures/clothes/monk[/b]
Overwrite if asked.

[url=http://lindsworkshop.tumblr.com/]You can stay updated on what I'm doing through my Tumblr.

[img]http://s18.postimg.org/gnyqvvwll/Tumblr_Lind.jpg[/img][/url]

For those of you who don't fancy Tumblr, [url=https://twitter.com/LindsRealm] I just made this.

[img]https://s24.postimg.org/qey3j9tp1/Twitter.png[/img][/url][url=http://lindsworkshop.tumblr.com/][/url][/center]

[center] -----------------------------------------------------------
[b][size=4]More Informations:[/size][/b]
-----------------------------------------------------------

[img]http://s28.postimg.org/4vmzlriql/Monk_Pre.jpg[/img]

As you probably have noticed, you can find various priests and priestesses in all the major cities of Skyrim, those guys wear the so called "Monk Robes", made of an orangeish robe and a yellow hood, which is, in my humble (and honest) opinion the worst looking piece of clothing in the vanilla game.

So I started thinking about the possible improvements, made a few decorated version of the base robes and still weren't happy with them. While I could make the robes look much better, they kept losing the monk-priest feeling that should come with meeting a character wearing these clothes. Needless to say, I ended up making a whole new version.
